text.0: Stay strong: A #hip #fracture can rob you of your independence. But these steps can help prevent a fracture in the first place. https://t.co/u7P7ghoRYF
text.1: At the 25th annual death and bereavement seminar at @HopkinsKids, pediatric residents were afforded a safe space to practice telling parents, played by actors, that their child has died. https://t.co/QeTywdYdT3
text.3: Excited to share my first-author paper @ScienceAdvances from undergrad research with Sol Snyder @HopkinsMedicine! We discovered that inositol pyrophosphate 5-InsP7 physiologically destabilizes the sodium-potassium pump via PI3K p85. https://t.co/PbVdFUj0wl
text.4: Johns Hopkins researchers show that #Blacks pursue more intensive treatments than #whites at the end of life, and whites use #Hospice more. @hopkinsmedicine @jhu_COAH @johnshopkinsSPH @JHhealthequity @MSHSGeriPalCare https://t.co/f0pEqfTXvJ https://t.co/OFl4hTOWF5
text.5: “It might be safer for kids not to go home, in terms of protecting their family, but we’re all very aware of the emotional toll that will take — to have families separated for the holidays,” said @HopkinsKids expert Aaron Milstone. https://t.co/s1VikxyYFD
text.6: Johns Hopkins Broadway Center for #Addiction’s director Kenneth Stoller says having supportive #housing is an important part of a patient’s #recovery. Learn more about the Wilson House. https://t.co/rn60f2ZtSV
text.7: Fantastic @HopkinsMedicine @OslerResidency Grand Rounds this morning with @tmprowell. Great reminder for this busy intern of why I’ve chosen this career path, thank you :folded_hands_light_skin_tone:
text.8: @gregrienzi Thank you for sharing your experience and kind words with us, Greg.
